contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=February 2009}} {{Infobox IRC network | name = GameSurge | image = [[Image:gslogo.png]] | founded_on = February 2004 | located_in = [[United States]]<br />[[Europe]] | based_in = [[World]]wide | executive_board = [http://www.gamesurge.net/organization/ Organization] | website_url = [http://www.gamesurge.net/ www.gamesurge.net] | primary_dns = [irc://irc.gamesurge.net irc.gamesurge.net] | average_users = {{IRC NQNS link|GameSurge|18,000 - 23,000}} | average_channels = {{IRC NQNS link|GameSurge|52,000 - 53,000}} | average_servers = {{IRC NQNS link|GameSurge|21}} | main_content = Public/[[Video Games]] }} '''GameSurge''' is a popular [[Internet Relay Chat]] network devoted to the online multiplayer gaming community. Games commonly seen referenced on GameSurge include many [[First-person shooter|first person shooters]] (such as [[Counter-Strike]], [[Counter-Strike: Source]], [[Team Fortress Classic]], [[Team Fortress 2]], [[Day of Defeat]], [[Call of Duty]], and [[Battlefield 2]]) and [[MMORPG]]s (such as [[World of Warcraft]] and [[Guild Wars]]). GameSurge is consistently in the top 10 IRC Networks by users currently online.<ref>[http://searchirc.com/network/GameSurge Search IRC]</ref><ref>[http://irc.netsplit.de/networks/GameSurge/]</ref> ==History== GameSurge was created in February 2004, as a result of the merger of GamesNET users and the ProGamePlayer Network, a network with common interests.<ref name="pgpn_merger">[http://www.irc101.org/news.php?id=370 GamesNET, ProGamePlayer Announce Network Merger]</ref> The merger, coincidentally, occurred during a time of legal disputes over the domain name gamesnet.net. At present day, the user base of GameSurge is primarily North American, with a growing number of [[English language|English-speaking]] gamers from [[Europe]]. The user base contains a large number of [[Clan (computer gaming)|clans]] who participate in a wide variety of games. Among the more popular games on GameSurge are ''Counter-Strike'', ''Counter-Strike: Source'', ''[[Team Fortress Classic]]'', ''[[Team Fortress 2]]'', ''[[Day of Defeat]]'', [[Urban Terror]] and ''[[Call of Duty]]''. == Services == GameSurge runs a [[feature-rich]] package of [[Internet Relay Chat services|services]] known as ''[[srvx]]'', which was written by GameSurge's development staff from scratch in [[C (programming language)|C]]. GameSurge provides five user-accessible services: *''AuthServ'', which provides authentication for other services on the network and allows users to use an [[User (computing)|account]] to maintain channel access. In the interests of providing a service directed toward gaming (and thus allowing users to easily switch clan/team/guild tags), GameSurge does not provide [[nickname]] registration. *''[[ChanServ]]'', which provides facilities such as event logging and advanced user/ban management. *''HelpServ'' bots, which manage support requests in certain channels via a [[FIFO]] queue. **''HelpServ'', in the ''#support'' channel, for general user support. **Other ''HelpServ'' bots in miscellaneous help channels throughout the network. *''SpamServ'', which provides spam protection services to channels on the network. This service was added in {{Start date|2008|7}}. *''HostServ'', which provides free "titles" to users wishing to use cloaked hosts. See the [http://www.gamesurge.net/titles GameSurge Titles] page for details. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.gamesurge.net/ GameSurge] *[http://www.srvx.net srvx] (network services for GameSurge) *[http://www.gamesurge.net/servers/ GameSurge Servers] {{IRC NQ|GameSurge}} {{IRC networks}} [[Category:Internet Relay Chat networks]] {{IRC-stub}}
